sub_title: Translator, Writer & Editor with Customer Service/Administration/Secretarial Skills
summary:
I am a professional who is always open to new and exciting challenges. I started working while I studied towards my BA in Translation and Interpreting. After obtaining my degree, I took a four-year study break in which I focused on gaining more work experience. I didn't restrict myself to my career: I was also a professor (including at the same place where I obtained my BA degree), and I gained some experience in customer service and administrative/office work. During these four years, I saved up to fulfill a big life-goal: to obtain a MA degree abroad, something that I achieved recently in the Netherlands. My next big goal is to go for a PhD, but first, I want to experience working in Europe, at an international company. The Netherlands is a great place to start!

Languages are my passion, and as such I have strong language- and communication-related abilities. I'm not only into translating; I can also do proofreading, editing and writing of all sorts of content. I particularly like dealing with blogs, magazines and social media, working with content destined to the popularization of science, and cultural topics.

I am responsible and organized, proactive and independent, result-oriented and a fast learner, able to deal with problems and make decisions. I am equally comfortable with teamwork and individual work. I love cultural diversity and deeply respect people’s differing opinions and attitudes derived from cultural differences. I act in the best interest of people I interact with. I am someone you can trust, both with sensitive information and with money. I am aware of my strengths and weaknesses, always willing to work on the latter.

I am keen to put my skills to good use and learn a lot from my colleagues, when someone gives me the chance to be a part of their team! Looking forward to it :)

projects.title: Master's Thesis 'Microstructural treatment, translation of idiomatic expressions in Spanish-English bilingual dictionaries, and their use in natural contexts'
projects.description:
The main fields of knowledge addressed in my thesis are bilingual lexicography and translation studies; the latter is also the name of a course included in the MA Linguistics programme. I intend to prepare and publish an article derived from my findings, together with my supervisor.

Idioms are especially complex because their structure and meaning are not as straightforward as in other expressions. They can appear in all registers and in any literary genre, including dictionaries. Various sets of strategies for the translation of idioms have been proposed by different authors. In my thesis I examined the translation strategies according to Baker (1992) used in two online bilingual dictionaries for the two types of idioms identified by Nunberg et al (1994), called 'idiomatically combining expressions' and 'idiomatic phrases'. I also looked into the microstructural treatment of said idioms in the analyzed dictionaries, and explored the forms in which they appear in natural contexts - that is, outside the dictionaries.

contributors.headline: Translator, Writer & Editor with Customer Service/Administration/Secretarial Skills

projects.title: Internship - Endangered Languages and Online Archiving
projects.description:
In the duration of my internship, I collaborated in the preparation of fieldwork data on endangered languages from the Papua New Guinea region, for their submission into an online language archive.

My internship took place at the Centre for Language Studies (CLS) within the Faculty of Arts, at Radboud University. My primary goal was to get to work with endangered languages, because I have been strongly interested in them since I was a child. I also wanted to gain experience and knowledge of documentary linguistics and field methods, to know the procedure a researcher has to follow to prepare data and materials for their submission into an online language archive for endangered languages. 

I worked on the transcription and analysis of some of the data collected in the field by my primary supervisor over the last ten years. I prepared audio, video and text materials for archiving, transcribed and edited audio and video field data using the specialized software programmes ELAN and Praat.

profile_positions.description:
I perform in the areas of Sales & Customer Service at a small local business (gift shop) - it's a part-time job.
- I use the point of sale system 'eleventa® Punto de Venta'
- I help to enter new items for sale and update past items in the previously mentioned system
- I check the beginning balance in the cash register at the start of the business day/my shift
- I am often responsible for balancing the cash register at the closing of the business day/my shift
- I help with the inventory and arrangement of incoming seasonal products (e.g. for Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, Christmas Day, graduation periods)
- I periodically rearrange merchandise in the shelves for a fresh look
- I remove older items that have not been sold after a while and show signs of irreparable damage
- I maintain the shop (counter, shelves, floor, etc.) clean and organized
- I collaborate in various side tasks, e.g. painting, folding and cutting materials for gifts
profile_positions.title: Shop Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Translation: Carried out all types of translation (general, technical, scientific -esp. medical and biological sciences-, cultural, financial/commercial, literary, legal) from and into any of these languages: Spanish, English, French.
Interpretation: Acted mainly as a medical interpreter, and a conference interpreter for scientific and cultural events.
profile_positions.title: Translator and Interpreter

profile_positions.description: This was my first actual laboral experience within the hospitality industry, in which I have been quite interested for a while, but I could not find the right conditions or the opportunity to work at some place related to it, until now. I really enjoyed it!

profile_positions.description:
Performed multiple functions, mainly in the areas of Sales & Customer Service at a small local business (a gift shop).
- Learned to use the point of sale system 'eleventa® Punto de Venta'
- Helped to inventory, enter and organize all the items for sale at the shop  in the previously mentioned POS system when it was first installed
- (before the POS was installed) Kept a handwritten list of all the items that were sold on my shift (e.g. item name, quantity, price per unit, total sum, payment method)
- Verified the beginning balance in the cash register at the start of the business day/my shift
- I was often responsible for balancing the cash register at the closing of the business day/my shift
- I was often asked by my boss to take with me the earnings of the day for safekeeping (when they were unable to show up for balancing the cash register), and handed them in the next day
- Helped with the inventory and arrangement of incoming seasonal products (e.g. gifts for Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, Christmas Day, graduation presents)

- Welcomed customers and asked them what they were seeking
- Directed customers towards the item(s) they were seeking, making suggestions or giving advice if required, or showed them around the shop if they were not seeking anything specific
- Periodically rearranged merchandise in the shelves for a fresh look
- Refilled the shelves with new items that were in storage when a noticable amount of items were sold, to maintain the variety in the merchandise
- Removed older items that had not been sold after a while and showed signs of damage
- Maintained the shop (furniture, equipment, shelves, floor, etc.) clean and organized
- Collaborated with my colleagues in various side tasks, e.g. painting and cutting materials for handmade gifts, decorating handcrafted centerpieces, wrapping custom-made presents
- Worked part-time during the academic year (due to my teaching jobs) and full-time during the holidays
profile_positions.title: Shop Assistant
